intro: Pinaropappus roseus var. maculatus, commonly known as the spotted pincushion cactus, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States. It features a compact, globular shape with spiny, segmented stems that are often covered in a distinctive spotted or mottled pattern. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are followed by fluffy, white seed-bearing structures. Its leaves are modified into spines, reducing water loss and adapting to harsh desert conditions. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained, sunny environments.
